intro: Piper riocajambrense, commonly known as the Río Cajambre pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically found in regions of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a rough texture. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in spikes, and it produces small, peppery berries that are used in traditional medicine. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
